Documentation of Submodules

nukebridge.gizmos.simplelivenode module

class nukebridge.gizmos.simplelivenode.SimpleLiveNode(gizmo=None, name=None)[source]

Bases: BaseLive

SimpleLiveNode is a class that inherits from the BaseLive class provided by the nukebridge package. This class serves as a simple example of how to use the BaseLive class.

The SimpleLiveNode class is responsible for creating and managing user interface elements (knobs) for the gizmo, tracking knob values, and updating live data based on knob values.

check_last_knob_value(xy, knob_name)[source]

Checks if the last known value of a knob is different from the current value.

Args:

xy (tuple): The current value of the knob. knob_name (str): The name of the knob.

Returns:

bool: True if the last known value is different from the current value, False otherwise.

create_generate_knobs()[source]

This method is responsible for creating the knobs (user interface elements) for the gizmo. It creates a new tab, adds a divider, creates a tracking knob, and calls the parent class’s method to create additional knobs. It also checks if there’s an ‘open_new_terminal’ knob and sets its value to True if it exists.

create_tracking_knob(n, neg=False)[source]

THis Creates a tracking knob on the gizmo. The knob is named ‘track_{n:02d}’ or ‘track_{n:02d}_neg’ if neg is True.

Args:

n (int): The number to use in the knob name. neg (bool): Whether to append ‘_neg’ to the knob name. Defaults to False.

knobChanged(knob=None)[source]

Handles a change in the value of a knob. If the knob is in ‘updateUI_knobs’ and its value has changed, or if the current frame has changed, a timer is started to call the ‘knob_change_handler’ method after a delay.

Args:

knob: The knob that has changed. Defaults to None.

update_live_data(knob)[source]

Updates the live data for a given knob. This method is intended to be overridden by subclasses to provide specific functionality for different types of knobs.

Args:

knob: The knob for which to update the live data.

Returns:

bool: False by default. Subclasses should return True if the live data for the knob was updated successfully.

nukebridge.gizmos.simplenode module

class nukebridge.gizmos.simplenode.SimpleNode(gizmo=None, name=None)[source]

Bases: Base

This is a simple class that inherits from the Base class. It’s a basic implementation of a node in the system.

Module contents

This module contains the NukeToolbarGenerator class which is responsible for generating a toolbar in Nuke with the gizmos defined in the current package.

The NukeToolbarGenerator class has methods to get the current package, get the classes defined in the current package, populate the toolbar with the gizmos, and reload the classes.

There is also a function, fix_mangled_text, defined in this module to fix any mangled text in the gizmo labels.

class nukebridge.gizmos.NukeToolbarGenerator(dev_mode: bool = False)[source]

Bases: object

The NukeToolbarGenerator class is responsible for generating a toolbar in Nuke with the gizmos defined in the current package.

The class has methods to get the current package, get the classes defined in the current package, populate the toolbar with the gizmos, and reload the classes.

Returns a dictionary of the classes defined in the current package.

get_current_file_path()[source]

Returns the path of the current file.

get_current_package() → Tuple[str, str][source]

Returns the name and path of the current package.

populate_toolbar(toolbar)[source]

Populates the toolbar with the gizmos defined in the current package.

static reload_classes(classes_list: str)[source]

Reloads the classes in the classes list.

nukebridge.gizmos.fix_mangled_text()[source]

Fixes any mangled text in the gizmo labels.
